story:
Once upon a time, in a lush and verdant village in Nigeria, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Ada. Ada was known throughout the village for her boundless imagination and her love of animals. She would spend hours playing in the forest, making friends with all the creatures she met along the way.

One day, as Ada was exploring the depths of the forest, she stumbled upon a mysterious clearing. In the center of the clearing stood a beautiful and ancient tree, its branches reaching up to the sky and its roots twisting and turning like the veins of a leaf. And as Ada approached the tree, she noticed something quite extraordinary: there was a small door carved into its trunk.

With a flutter of excitement in her heart, Ada gently pushed open the door and stepped inside. To her amazement, she found herself in a magical world filled with talking animals, sparkling streams, and lush gardens. And at the heart of this enchanted land was a wise and gentle queen who welcomed Ada with open arms.

The queen told Ada that she was the guardian of this magical realm, and that she had been waiting for someone pure of heart to help her on a very important quest. It seemed that a wicked sorcerer had stolen the queen's most precious possession: a golden apple that held the power to keep the magical realm thriving and healthy. Without it, the realm would slowly wither and die.

Ada knew that she had to help the queen, so she set off on a perilous journey to find the wicked sorcerer and retrieve the golden apple. Along the way, she encountered many challenges and made many new friends, who all helped her on her quest.

At last, Ada reached the sorcerer's lair, a dark and twisted castle built on a stormy cliffside. With the help of her new friends, Ada bravely fought her way past the sorcerer's guards and confronted the wicked sorcerer himself. After a fierce battle, Ada emerged victorious and claimed the golden apple.

With the apple in her hands, Ada returned to the magical realm and was hailed as a hero. The queen was overjoyed to have her precious possession back, and the realm began to flourish once more. And as a reward, the queen granted Ada a special gift: the ability to visit the magical realm whenever she pleased, as long as she kept her heart pure and kind.

From that day on, Ada spent many happy hours in the magical realm, playing with her new friends and learning the secrets of the enchanted land. And whenever she returned home, she brought with her a little bit of the magic, spreading joy and wonder to all those around her.

And so, my dear daughter, as you drift off to sleep tonight, I hope that you too will dream of magical realms and brave adventures, and that you will always keep your heart pure and kind. Goodnight, my sweet girl.
